716788f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Houston Street (East)
716788f-a.text:
The Bowery, east side, north from East Houston Street to Cooper
Union (extreme left) and showing an early view of this important
thoroughfare prior to the construction of the Elevated Line. The Savings
Bank appearing on the right and adjoining the N.E. corner of Houston Street
is the Mechanics and Traders, No. 283 Bowery, according to Gouldings
Business Directory of 1875. Rands New York City Business Directory of
1877 list: same as a National Bank with a location given as Ho. 153.
The building bearing the flags is the Germania Assembly Rooms. North of
the latter and occupying the S.E. and N.E. corners of East 1st Street are
two low buildings; one with a hip roof. These remain today (1938) though
the rest of the outline has disappeared. Note the 4 sets of rails in the
road bed, several of which appear with horse drawn cars thereon.
1870.

716787f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Houston Street (East)
716787f-a.text:
The Bowery, north from East Houston Street,
to Cooper Square.
This photo is a duplicate of a larger print
included in this collection.
About 1890
Gift Thru The New York Historical Sootety

716786f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Houston Street (East)
716786f-a.text:
Bewery, west side, north from but not including East Houston
Street.
May 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

716785f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Houston Street (East)
716785f-a.text:
Bowery, east side, north from East Houston Street. The view shows
an empty lot at the N.E. corner. (A relic of the subway construction
on East Houston Street, for a branch line of the Municipal Eighth Ave.,
Subway) utilized for a parking space. The stair approach to the
East Houston Street Station of the Third Ave., Elevated is shown on the
left. Against the skyline, in the background, is silhouetted the
Empire State and the Metropolitan Life Insurance Buildings.
May 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

716785f-b.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Houston Street (East)
716785f-b.text:
Bowery, east side, north from East Houston Street. The view shows
an empty lot at the N.E. corner. (A relic of the subway construction
on East Houston Street, for a branch line of the Municipal Eighth Ave.,
Subway) utilized for a parking space. The stair approach to the
East Houston Street Station of the Third Ave., Elevated is shown on the
left. Against the skyline, in the background, is silhouetted the
Empire State and the Metropolitan Life Insurance Buildings.
May 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

716789f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Houston Street (East)
716789f-a.text:
Bowery, north from East Houston Street, to Cooper Square, showing
the Third Ave. Elevated Line with a steam drawn train thereon. Straet cars
at this date were horse drawn. Note on the left, Hartfield the
Costumer, Callahan the Hatter and the Globe Museum.
About 1890.
Ewing Galloway.
Nea a~~ 95E
